GmBobbyToboadaDemonstratesBalintawakArni.name: GM Bobby Toboada demonstrates Balintawak Arnis to various SWAT operators.
GmBobbyToboadaDemonstratesBalintawakArni.summary: GM Bobby Toboada demonstrates Balintawak Arnis to various SWAT operators from across North Carolina at the North Carolina Justice Academy.

PhilippineArmyOfficerCandidatesPerformPe.name: Philippine Army Officer Candidates perform Pekiti Tirsia Kali I Filipino Martial Arts
PhilippineArmyOfficerCandidatesPerformPe.summary: Peketi Tirsia Kali (PTK) is a style specific to Filipino martial arts. it is a combat-oriented system, as opposed to a sport-focused fighting style. It is a fighting system that focuses on edged, impact and improvised weapons. it has been adopted as the preferred combative training program by Armed Forces of the Philippines and law enforcement units around the world.

UsAndPhilippineForcesEngageInMartialArts.name: US and Philippine Forces Engage in Martial Arts Training
UsAndPhilippineForcesEngageInMartialArts.summary: Philippine martial arts, known collectively as Arnis, Eskrima, or Kali, are traditional combat practices that encompass a variety of fighting techniques. These arts are characterized by the use of sticks, knives, and empty-hand techniques, making them versatile and practical for both self-defense and combat. Rooted in the rich cultural history of the Philippines, these martial arts were developed by indigenous tribes and have been passed down through generations. They emphasize fluid movements, speed, and adaptability, allowing practitioners to seamlessly transition between weapons and hand-to-hand combat.
